title: Northrop Grumman and Firefly’s Antares 330 and MLV plans take shape
summary: As the Cygnus S.S. Laurel Clark spends its first days berthed to the ISS, the successor to the Antares 230+ launch vehicle that launched it is taking shape in the facilities of Northrop Grumman (NG) and Firefly Aerospace.

title: NASA Software Catalog Offers Free Programs for Earth Science, More
summary: Each year, NASA scientists, engineers, and developers create software packages to manage space missions, test spacecraft, and analyze the petabytes of data produced by agency research satellites. As the agency innovates for the benefit of humanity, many of these programs are now downloadable and free of charge through NASA’s Software Catalog.

title: Clogged propellant lines doomed NASA lunar cubesat mission
summary: A NASA lunar cubesat mission failed to go into orbit around the moon earlier this year when debris blocked propellant lines for the spacecraft’s thrusters.

title: The Smallsat Show-me Era
summary: The derivative impact on the smallsat industrial base is also clear: smallsat space hardware and launch companies that have built a track record can capitalize on this shift, driving growth and expanded moats, while newer entrants may find it increasingly difficult to carve out a defensible niche.

title: From Customization to Standardization
summary: Smallsats need standardizing now more than ever

title: BlackSky buys five Electron launches
summary: BlackSky, one of Rocket Lab’s biggest launch customers, has bought an additional five Electron launches for its next-generation imaging satellites.

title: Cracks in Ancient Martian Mud Surprise NASA's Curiosity Rover Team
summary: A new paper suggests the same conditions that created the cracks could have been favorable to the emergence of microscopic life.

title: Vyoma orders pilot satellites for debris-monitoring constellation
summary: German startup Vyoma has ordered two pilot satellites for its proposed space debris-monitoring constellation from EnduroSat, the eight-year-old Bulgarian cubesat specialist.

title: NASA weighs changes to Artemis 3 if key elements are delayed
summary: NASA has left the door open for changing the scope of Artemis 3, currently set to be the first crewed lunar landing of the program, if key elements suffer major delays.

title: Download your Wednesday ‘News from the 2023 Small Satellite show’ digital edition
summary: The SpaceNews editorial team is producing a daily for the 2023 Small Satellite show, a nightly email newsletter and all-day web coverage during the 2023 Small Satellite show in Logan, Utah, the […]
